meanings.definition: A person who makes or sells distilled spirits.
meanings.sent1: The stiller at the distillery carefully crafted each batch of whiskey.
meanings.sent2: The local stiller is known for producing high-quality vodka.
meanings.sent3: The stiller joked that they were the 'spirit whisperer' of the town.
meanings.sent4: She was a stiller in the art of creating unique flavors in her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The stiller's expertise in distillation was unmatched in the region.

meanings.sent1: She worked stiller than anyone else in the office.
meanings.sent2: The wind blew stiller as the storm passed.
meanings.sent3: He moved stiller than a statue, trying not to wake the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass stiller in the peaceful countryside.
meanings.sent5: The night grew stiller as the moon rose higher in the sky.

meanings.definition: A device used to distill liquids.
meanings.sent1: The copper stiller gleamed in the sunlight outside the brewery.
meanings.sent2: The old stiller had been in the family for generations.
meanings.sent3: The stiller bubbled and hissed as it worked its magic on the liquid.
meanings.sent4: The moonshine stiller was hidden deep in the woods to avoid detection.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the stiller fascinated the curious onlookers.
